Dear Mr. Hull;
I appreciate very much your letter of February 2 inviting me to write an
article for the H.A.E.35. newsletter. I am inclosing the article with this
letter and hope it is satisfactory.
In the past, 1 have corresponded with your executive secretary Mr. Morris
S„ Novik of Hew York, and in our correspondence I have told him of our
work. I tried to contact him when 1 was in Hew York City last December,
but was unable to do so.
I do believe that our organizations have something in common with reference
to PM broadcasting. In the first place, I believe that low power FM is the
answer to getting PM 82ts in the home. Our Texas Baptist Radio Department
is sponsoring some nln■» or ten FM commercial station hex© In Texas., We
now have seven construction permits, with one of the seven on the air, XMHB,
Belton, Texas. FM hers in the South has not developed as fast as it has in
your section or in the East. People do not have Hi sets to listen to the
broadcasts. Standard broadcasters have not helped FM by giving one-hundred
per-cent duplication of their AM stations. Her© is where I believe low power
PM comes in for the churches.
It was not my Idea to get low pcver PM transmitters? only for Baptist churches
but for all churches, ind our petition now before the PCC in Washington, or
that will be before them within the next week, so states t}ial it is for all
churches. I would certainly like for your organization tip have an under¬
standing of what we are trying to do, because we are asking that these low
power PM sets be in the 88 to 92 megacycles, which Is the educational band.
I cannot see where ther^ would be any conflict between colleges and schools
working together with churches sharing frequencies* In other words, the
church will do most of their broadcasting during the week days. In this
way they could share frequency, and certainly the time could "be worked out
to a mutual understanding and to the benefit of both. 1 do not believe there
is any organization that can get more FM sets in the homes in a city than
the churches can.
